instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here a couple of months ago that was not powering on. I fixed it and now it turns on and works with external display but no internal. I ordered a new LCD assembly to test, which works on another machine, but on this machine it does not work, just like original one. No video and no backlight. Tried replacing LVDS cable, still same. Where can I begin the troubleshooting? I tried replacing <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> as it was getting 5V and I thought it may be not sending out <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> but still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
threads.message:
Did you change it without checking if output voltage is present?

Check J8500 basic voltages; pins 44, 45, 6.
If good, check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> data lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
threads.message: No voltage present on pins 6/44/45. I have no enable signal on <SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PANEL_P3V3_EN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
threads.message:
Check mentioned voltages at the same time when the machine chimes.
You should get a pulse for 2-3s at least.
Also check <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue.
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> data lines anyway.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Video
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> - 0.002"
As expected; CPU's eDP output is damaged.
There are no series capacitors to protect data lines.
